text:
February 22, 1957
Dr, Burton Paulu
K U 0 M, One Eddy Hall
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
Just so you*11 know I’m still alive. I’ll record some inten¬
tions. Meanwhile, hope you’ve recovered from the ’flu. I’ll be
sending you comments or reports on the following:
1. Reply to Executive Committee inquiry regarding probable
status of the JOURNAL.
2. Report of visit with Ed Stasheff.
3. Report of JCET executive committee meeting.
4. Report of visit with Dr. Faust.
5. Report of session with NBC’s VP Joe Heffeman.
6. Report on JOURNAL request response. Right here. Picked
up article from Ed Stasheff he was planning to forward. Picked up
promise of review from Stasheff. Received three or four from Tracy —
he, too. was just ready to mail me. Dan O’Connor (with Elmer in
Florida) wrote and sent along an article.
?. We have now billed everyone on the old AERT list, subscribers
and memberships, and we are getting back some monies, some cancel¬
lations, ana some data that will help us improve listing. Some real
dead ones on the list. Example: Ola sends back note that teacher
listed as AERT active member has been gone from Flint for two years.
When we get this process done, we ought to be able to divide between
subscribers and memberships. That’s desirable.
8. Hope to see Dick and Keith In Columbus on Monday.
9* Will respond to Miles’ committee letters. I hold some
different opinions. In degrees, and shall express them and why. In
part, this may overlap 1 above or be a total answer to the inquiries.
10. Better come down with the Minnesota basketball team next
Saturday.
